item.title: Report E-2024080594
item.description:
Report E-2024080594

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T15:13:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a trailer loading operation at Veolia's 10-day in-transit facility in Port Allen, Louisiana, an employee observed a small puddle of liquid on the ground beneath a recently moved pallet. Upon closer examination, it was discovered that one of the drums on the pallet had sustained a minor gash near its base. The leak was estimated to be approximately half an ounce of liquid. The spill was immediately addressed using oil-dry absorbent material, and the damaged drum was safely transferred into an overpack container to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report I-2024080072
item.description:
Report I-2024080072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: Port Allen
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/7/2024 1 pallet of UN 1789 Hydrochloric Acid(Muriatic Acid) was sitting in the SEFL BTR OS&D Bay. The pallet containing 84 boxes with 2 each 1 gallon bottles inside collapsed& fell over. The pallet collapsing caused an estimated 10 gallons to spill on the dock. The spill was contained by dock associates. SEFL Safety was contacted, and contacted Hazmat 1 spill response. E3/OMI arrived on site at approximately 9:15. The team accessed the situation& proceeded with the clean up process. Clean up was complete at approximately 13:30. In total 10-55 gallon drums were used to contain the waste.E3/OMI will return to pick up the waste drums at a later date, once approval has been received.
